what-it-does: Checks for unnecessary list() calls around list comprehensions.
why-is-this-bad: It is redundant to use a list() call around a list comprehension.
example:
list([f(x) for x in foo])



Use instead


[f(x) for x in foo]
fix-safety:
This rule's fix is marked as unsafe, as it may occasionally drop comments
when rewriting the call. In most cases, though, comments will be preserved.

example-split.example-before:
list([f(x) for x in foo])



Use instead


[f(x) for x in foo]
